901eed20-3999-4c7c-a9e3-416e48830ffa.description: This badge signifies that a learner has proven their ability to take a basic problem statement in the context of software development and/or DevOps and designed a suitable solution for said problem statement. The learner has developed their problem-solving skills in the context of technology, as well as showcased their ability to work in a team and present a sound solution that they have designed.
901eed20-3999-4c7c-a9e3-416e48830ffa.name: QA Academy Hackfest – Gold Badge

alignments.name: Recommended next steps #1
alignments.description: • Continue the QA Academy in Software or Cloud & DevOps

alignments.name: Recommended next steps #2
alignments.description: • Move onto full-stack development by training in an applicable tech stack, such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript

alignments.name: Recommended next steps #3
alignments.description: • Move onto further development by learning about how to code in the cloud, such as AWS

badge_template_activities.title: The learner completed a team-based hackfest – a project with lean deadlines and minimal direction. Within a team, the learner was able to take a problem statement from a briefing and design a solution that met the set requirements. Using their previous knowledge and experience of technology, the learner was able to work with like-minded individuals to scope an appropriate solution, as well as participate in Scrum meetings and present their final deliverable to an excellent standard.

521ca1fb-2526-435e-9a85-4fedb9b7b2ce.description: This badge signifies that the Learning Specialist has a fundamental understanding of the essentials required to deliver interactive and engaging learning events. The Learning Specialist, through facilitative training and collaborative working, has demonstrated the application of their learning via a micro-teach and observation.
521ca1fb-2526-435e-9a85-4fedb9b7b2ce.name: Learning Excellence Training Awareness

badge_template_activities.title: The Learning Specialist completed a 5-day interactive session, based on group workshops, independent activities and peer reviews. Assessments took place throughout each session against the activities set, and culminated in a final assessment, based on a micro teaching session to their peers.
The Learning Specialist will apply their learning to their core delivery, with a follow-up observation and development activities.

22fef801-8655-43ed-bfc6-6d8f51a88dea.description: This badge signifies that a learner has proven their ability to take a basic problem statement in the context of software development and/or DevOps and design a suitable solution. This solution was presented alongside several others and judged as the most innovative and appropriate to meet the problem statement. The learner has developed their problem-solving skills in the context of technology, and showcased their ability to work in a team and present a sound solution that they have designed.
22fef801-8655-43ed-bfc6-6d8f51a88dea.name: QA Academy Hackfest – Platinum Badge

alignments.name: Recommended next steps #1
alignments.description: • Continue the QA Academy in Software or Cloud & DevOps

alignments.name: Recommended next steps #2
alignments.description: • Move onto full-stack development by training in an applicable tech stack, such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript

alignments.name: Recommended next steps #3
alignments.description: • Move onto further development by learning about how to code in the cloud, such as AWS

badge_template_activities.title: The learner completed a team-based hackfest – a project with lean deadlines and minimal direction. Within a team, the learner took a problem statement from a briefing and designed an appropriate solution that met set requirements. The learner then presented their final deliverable to an excellent standard. The learner's presentation, deliverable and overall teamwork throughout was judged by a panel of experts to be the best of all teams, thereby awarding the learner with the platinum award.

e0b07b11-6a69-4799-b02d-8553332ca31d.description: This badge signifies that the earner has proven fundamental theoretical and practical Agile skills in a workplace context. These skills have then been translated into the workplace to implement Agile practices, tools or techniques, proving the ability to ‘be agile while doing Agile’.
e0b07b11-6a69-4799-b02d-8553332ca31d.name: Applied Agile Fundamentals

badge_template_activities.title: Individuals with this badge completed a blended learning course that involved both self-paced digital learning and facilitator-led workshops. Individuals gained an understanding of the ICAgile Agile fundamentals (ICP), and acquired knowledge on the history of Agile, the Agile Mindset, values, principles and key concepts. Finally, this theoretical knowledge was applied hands-on in a practical-focused workshop, where individuals applied their Agile skills and developed key Agile artifacts.

Individuals with this badge have taken their newly found Agile skills and applied them into their workplace environment. These badge holders have worked with their employer and training facilitator to individually define and fulfill activities to implement Agile practices at work.

Individuals with this badge have developed Agile knowledge and competency, and undertaken a facilitated learning event. Individuals have also performed key Agile concepts including adaptive planning, value-driven development and team collaboration

af1e4f61-e448-45a4-b0dc-e4f63c6c8b81.description: This badge signifies that an earner has proven fundamental theoretical and practical Product Ownership skills in a workplace context. These skills have then been translated into the workplace, implementing Product Owner tools or techniques, to showcase their ability to deliver value for stakeholders and customers.
af1e4f61-e448-45a4-b0dc-e4f63c6c8b81.name: ICAgile Product Owner

badge_template_activities.title: This earner completed a blended learning course that involved both self-paced learning and facilitator-led workshops. Individuals gained an understanding of the ICAgile Product Ownership learning areas, acquiring knowledge on what product ownership is, the key skills of a Product Owner, how to deliver value, managing the product roadmap and product vision. Finally, this theoretical knowledge was applied hands-on in a practical-focused workshop, where individuals developed key agile artifacts.

The earner was able to take their newly found Product Owner skills and apply them into their workplace environment. They worked with their employer and training facilitator to individually define and fulfill activities to implement Product Owner skills and techniques at work.

2c35dc49-47be-4570-b0e9-7adaa4ef54cd.description: This badge signifies that the earner has proven their ReactJS theoretical and practical skills in a workplace context. They've developed their skills as a developer, and have translated their new skills back into the workplace, by individually implementing a React solution that fulfilled a set of stakeholder needs.
2c35dc49-47be-4570-b0e9-7adaa4ef54cd.name: Real World ReactJS

badge_template_activities.title: Individuals with this badge completed a blended learning course that involved both self-paced digital learning as well as facilitator-led workshops.

Individuals with this badge have applied their newly found skills into a workplace environment. These badge holders have worked with their employer and their training facilitator to individually fulfil a set of requirements, with React as the primary solutioning language, and using their own expertise, and technical ability, alongside additional documentation, code references and support.

Individuals with this badge have worked with their employer and their training facilitator to individually fulfil a set of requirements, with React as the primary solutioning language, and using their own expertise, and technical ability, alongside additional documentation, code references and support.

e2cb2230-6358-4cb5-a9f2-a84f2b2660cd.description: This badge signifies that the earner has developed fundamental Azure knowledge and practical Azure administration skills. The earner is also familiar with key Azure best practices, including working with virtual machines and understanding virtual networking. Finally, the earner has translated their skills into the workplace to fulfill a set of stakeholder needs and to prove their ability to support an Azure Cloud IaaS deployment.
e2cb2230-6358-4cb5-a9f2-a84f2b2660cd.name: Microsoft Azure Administrator

badge_template_activities.title: This earner completed a blended learning course that involved both self-paced digital learning as well as facilitator-led workshops. The earner gained an understanding of the key Azure technologies, infrastructure considerations, and administrational best practices. They were then able to apply this theoretical knowledge within a series of objectives-based labs, to practise their deployment and configuration skills, and build a working Azure infrastructure from the ground up.

The earner was able to take their newly found Azure technology knowledge and Cloud support skills and apply them into their workplace environment. They worked with their employer and training facilitator to individually define and fulfill activities, and to implement both new Azure services and manage existing ones.

c7cd27fe-cc65-4499-9cf3-eb78a7eee739.description: This badge signifies that the DLC has demonstrated their capability in highly effective, coaching facilitation.The DLC, through an ongoing and in-depth programme of development, coaching, knowledge awareness, and recognition of further areas for development, has demonstrated the application of their learning through the delivery of customer facing learning interventions.
c7cd27fe-cc65-4499-9cf3-eb78a7eee739.name: Fundamentals In Coaching Programme

badge_template_activities.title: The DLC has completed a multi-month programme (up to 12 months) of continued professional development, including both in-depth delivery and theoretical content. Learning is based on a personalised development plan with optional 1-2-1 coaching and mentoring.
The DLC will apply their learning to their core delivery with follow up observation, development activities, plus coaching and mentoring.

skills.name: The SMARTER approach to goal setting

31e71bd7-a50c-43dc-acf2-1be88078a8cf.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated fundamental digital forensics skills, gaining the ability to conduct data recovery investigations, disc image analysis, and forensic analysis investigations. Practical hands-on achievements include - timeline analysis, hash filtering, keyword searches, artifact discovery, data carving, multimedia (EXIF) analysis, ophcrack analysis, and registry explorer investigation.
31e71bd7-a50c-43dc-acf2-1be88078a8cf.name: Digital Forensics Fundamentals

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have completed the following: established investigative timelines, flagged known bad files, and bypassed known good files during investigative searches. Conducted indexed keyword searches to identify files with terms relevant to the investigation. Extracted browser history, bookmarks, cookies, search terms from several search engines. Recovered deleted files from unallocated or slack space on the target computer system. Extracted EXIF data from recovered photos and reconstructed videos.

a3ffeee6-58c3-4439-a683-594bf075dfdb.description: Earners of this badge have proven practical skills in using Power BI to create and publish reports. Earners of this badge have also demonstrated the ability to use the Power BI data connectivity tools to retrieve data. They have created visualisations and reports using the various tools available within Power Bi and have demonstrated a best practice situational understanding of when to use the different visualisations for different data types.
a3ffeee6-58c3-4439-a683-594bf075dfdb.name: Power BI Desktop for Business Users

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge completed a blended learning course that involved both self-paced digital learning as well as facilitator-led workshops. Earners of this badge also gained an understanding of key Power BI concepts and main features. Finally, earners of this badge learned theoretical knowledge and applied it in a hands-on environment, where they practiced using Power BI within a practical-focused workshop.

Earners of this badge took their newly found Power BI skills and applied them into their corporate environment. Earners of this badge also worked with their employer and training facilitator to individually define and action an agreed implementation of their Power BI knowledge and skills.

9407d3ac-2ea4-4c6b-b6f4-24aeaf6e857b.description: This badge signifies that this earner has proven theoretical and practical Python programming experience in a workplace context. Earners also understand key Python best practices which include but are not limited to, writing short programs, using functions and packages, writing Python programs using Object-Oriented methods, writing Python programs that use external data sources, and using error handling and testing to make programs robust.
9407d3ac-2ea4-4c6b-b6f4-24aeaf6e857b.name: Practical Introduction to Python

badge_template_activities.title: The earner gained a fundamental understanding of the key Python programming concepts and constructs through a blended learning course. The course involved self-paced digital learning, facilitator-led workshops and real workplace application. The course ensured that earners experienced creating Python scripts and utilised the core Python syntax, Object-Orientated Programming principles, key techniques for storing and processing data, and interacted with the file system and databases.

The earner designed and developed a Python-based application in the workplace. In building this application, the earner implemented Object-Orientated Programming, used coding best practices, used appropriate testing techniques, and utilised effective source control into the process of app development.

3f457a15-a7f8-44e2-a8e7-91bfa42e3e54.description: This earner completed a blended learning course comprising self-paced digital learning, facilitator-led workshops and workplace application. This Impact Badge signifies that this earner has developed knowledge on, and applied the fundamental concepts of Microsoft Azure to a professionally acceptable standard.
3f457a15-a7f8-44e2-a8e7-91bfa42e3e54.name: Azure Fundamentals

badge_template_activities.title: The earner gained an understanding of the following topics: Cloud Computing Concepts, Core Azure Services / utility of these technologies, Core Solutions and Management tools, General Security & Network Features of Microsoft Azure, Identity, Governance & Privacy features, and the cost and Service Management considerations of Azure Services. Earners will now be well-versed on the benefits of moving to the Cloud and will have an awareness of the vast array of services that Azure offers.

This badge proves that this earner was able to complete the following steps to a professionally acceptable standard: 1. Consider their company’s cloud solution or future strategy. 2. Select aspects of their solution or specific areas which and deepen their knowledge in those areas through self-led exploration 3. Credibly present their findings in the areas explored at a management meeting.

9a4ce443-f6d8-4486-b83a-56a7aef07aa0.description: This badge signifies that the earner can deploy practical Azure design skills to architect effective Azure Infrastructure and Application platform solutions, The earner demonstrated competency with the following Azure design domains: Governance, Compute, Application Architecture, Storage, Data, Authentication Authorization and Identity, Networking Backup and DRM, Monitoring, and Migrating. Finally, this earner translated these skills into the workplace, fulfilling a set of stakeholder needs.
9a4ce443-f6d8-4486-b83a-56a7aef07aa0.name: Designing Microsoft Azure Infrastructure Solutions

badge_template_activities.title: This earner completed a blended learning course that involved both self-paced digital learning and facilitator-led workshops. The earner gained an understanding of the key Azure service design considerations and best practices. This earner then applied their theoretical knowledge in a practical-focused workshop, practicing design skills and selecting appropriate Azure technologies, through a series of exercises, where they designed an effective Azure architecture from the ground up.

The earner was able to take their newly found Azure design skills and apply them to the design of a specific Cloud based service. They worked with their employer and training facilitator in order to define a new or existing service and to develop a design report addressing the deployment or migration of this service into the Azure cloud. The design report incorporated one or more of the key design domains addressed within the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework guidance.

80cb0975-628a-4db9-bc45-2cfac48ac7ec.description: This badge signifies that the earner has a fundamental understanding of the essentials required to plan, evaluate, and feedback on Observation, Teaching and Learning Assessments in relation to QA internal process. Through training, shadowing, and coaching, the earner has demonstrated the application of their learning and the ability to assess trainer performance using the six learning principles.
80cb0975-628a-4db9-bc45-2cfac48ac7ec.name: Observation, Teaching and Learning Assessment

badge_template_activities.title: The Learning Specialist completed a 5-day interactive session, based on group workshops, independent activities, and peer reviews. Assessments took place throughout each session against the activities set, culminating in a final assessment, based on a micro teaching session to their peers.
The Learning Specialist will apply their learning to their core delivery, with follow up observation and development activities.

8ae56e08-4c9f-4624-92b6-c21878a31ac2.description: This badge signifies that the Learning Specialist has demonstrated their capability in highly effective, teaching, learning, facilitation and training skills within the STAR Programme. Through an ongoing and in-depth programme of coaching, knowledge awareness, and recognition of further areas for development, the Learning Specialist has demonstrated the application of their learning through delivery of customer facing learning interventions in the fields of teaching, learning and group delivery.
8ae56e08-4c9f-4624-92b6-c21878a31ac2.name: Learning Excellence STAR programme

badge_template_activities.title: The Learning Specialist has completed a multi-month programme (3 months) of continued professional development, including both in-depth delivery and theoretical content, independent learning, shadow observation activities and co-delivery activities. Learning is based on a personalised development plan with added 1-2-1 coaching and mentoring.
The Learning Specialist will apply their learning to their core delivery with follow up observations and development activities, plus coaching and mentoring.

skills.name: Applying connections and links to the wider world
Creating challenging experiences and transferable skills
Theory supporting Delivery Training and Facilitation

f3beee4e-e0a3-4b80-9aee-b6934898c55b.description: This badge signifies that an earner has demonstrated practical ITIL® Service Management skills in a workplace context. These skills include the key concepts of service management, the 7 key ITIL® practices, the four dimensions of service management, and the component parts of the ITIL® Service Value System (SVS).
f3beee4e-e0a3-4b80-9aee-b6934898c55b.name: Service Management Workplace Impact

badge_template_activities.title: This earner completed a blended learning course that involved both self-paced digital learning as well as a facilitator-led workshop. The earner gained an understanding of the latest ITIL®4 Service Management best practices, and acquired knowledge on the key tenets of the ITIL® Framework. They were then able to take this theoretical knowledge and apply it to a work package in their production environment.

This badge validates that this earner has successfully leveraged two or more of the following ITIL® tools in the workplace, including, the creation of a CIR (Cyber Incident Response), the creation and implementation of a knowledge base, the creation and implementation of a change authority matrix, and the creation of a training plan to improve service provision (focusing on incident, request or problem Management databases).

1129eef3-9a05-4ae0-8c6c-ebbb2fc72ac2.description: This badge signifies that the Learning Specialist has demonstrated their capability in highly effective, learning facilitation. The Learning Specialist, through an ongoing and in-depth programme of development, coaching, mentoring and assessment, has demonstrated the application of their learning through delivery of customer facing learning interventions.
1129eef3-9a05-4ae0-8c6c-ebbb2fc72ac2.name: Learning Excellence Facilitator

badge_template_activities.title: The Learning Specialist has completed a multi- month programme (up to 12 months) of continued professional development, including both in-depth delivery and theoretical content. Learning is based on a personalized development plan with optional 1-2-1 coaching and mentoring.
The Learning Specialist will apply their learning to their core delivery with follow up observation, development activities plus coaching and mentoring.

ab40586d-9e25-4823-a248-845291beb01a.description: Earners of this badge have proven their ability to enroll and manage Windows clients using both ‘traditional’ and ‘modern’ methods. They’ve developed fundamental Windows deployment competencies and undertaken a facilitated learning event. Earners have also planned and implemented a Windows 10 / 11 enrolment, management, and update solution. Using Microsoft Endpoint Manager, Azure AD and Office365 Portals, earners have also managed their Windows client estate and Apple and Android devices.
ab40586d-9e25-4823-a248-845291beb01a.name: Managing Modern Desktops

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge completed a blended learning course that involved both self-paced digital learning as well as facilitator-led workshops. Earners of this badge have also gained an understanding of key Windows deployment tools and techniques. Finally, earners of this badge learned the best practice for desktop and device deployment, and begin apply this within a hands-on environment.

Earners of this badge took their newly found desktop and device deployment skills and applied them within their production environment. Earners of this badge also worked with their employer and training facilitator to individually define and fulfil activities to deploy and implement desktop environments.

14855856-d7c7-4a3e-906c-2652585b5278.description: This badge signifies that, through task-based activities, the earner has the proven knowledge and skills to secure Azure Active Directory authentication and to deploy Microsoft 365 Defender to protect against cyber threats. Proven competencies include, but are not limited to: navigating the portals and administrative roles used to secure Microsoft 365, configuring Azure Active Directory to provide strong authentication, and configuring Defender for Office 365 to protect emails.
14855856-d7c7-4a3e-906c-2652585b5278.name: Microsoft 365 Security Administrator

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge have the knowledge and skills to secure Azure Active Directory authentication and to deploy Microsoft 365 Defender to protect against cyber threats. Earners also learned how to configure security across messaging and collaboration tools, devices, identities, and applications. Finally, earners have proven competencies using Microsoft Secure Score to measure any actions taken, and to provide evidence of an improved security posture.
The learner has undertaken a review of their organisation’s security posture and created a prioritisation list of recommended security improvements and enhancements.

4eababb9-8aa6-45d1-bace-3d834d751e94.description: This badge signifies that the earner has demonstrated a practical understanding of the principles of cloud computing, core Azure services and Azure management, and governance features and tools. Proven competencies include, but are not limited to: describing the core architectural components of Azure, describing Azure compute and networking services, describing Azure storage services, describing Azure identity, access, and security, and describing cost management in Azure.
4eababb9-8aa6-45d1-bace-3d834d751e94.name: Microsoft Azure Fundamentals (Technical)

badge_template_activities.title: This earner completed a blended learning course that involved both self-paced digital learning as well as a facilitator-led workshop. The earner gained an understanding of key cloud computing principles and through digital learning, acquired knowledge of the core Azure technologies. They were then able to take this theoretical knowledge and apply it to a work package in their production environment.

This badge validates that this earner has understood the key features and benefits of core Azure technologies, and they have used that knowledge to create a Business Case Report that identifies potential benefits their company can gain by adopting Azure services.

e8a48bb0-ac05-47d5-9bf6-781074cebe95.description: Earners of this badge have proven practical skills in administering and troubleshooting Windows Client Operating Systems. Badge earners will have also demonstrated the ability to install, configure, and update Windows 10 and Windows 11, manage user and device accounts, and manage devices and drivers. Finally, badge earners will have shown that they are able to administer storage file systems, permissions, networking, apps and browsers, and shown a fundamental understanding of Windows security.
e8a48bb0-ac05-47d5-9bf6-781074cebe95.name: Microsoft Windows Client

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge completed a blended learning course that involved both self-paced digital learning as well as facilitator-led workshops. Badge earners gained an understanding of key Windows administration and troubleshooting tools and techniques. Finally, badge earners got to apply their theoretical knowledge in a practical-focused workshop, where they practised using Windows administration tools.

Earners of this badge took their newly found Windows administration skills and applied them into their corporate environment. Badge earners also worked with their employer and training facilitator to individually define and action an agreed implementation of their Windows Desktop support knowledge and skills.

be913233-aa64-4298-845e-cbcaca3c73f1.description: This badge signifies that the earner has proven practical ability to plan, configure, and manage an Office 365 environment. The earner has acquired and proven, through activities and task-based activities, key skills requirement for Office 365 administration. The earner is able to: Provision an Office 365 tenant including adding custom domains, Manage Office 365 access, Configure directory synchronization, Deploy Microsoft 365 apps, Configure Exchange online, and configure Microsoft Teams.
be913233-aa64-4298-845e-cbcaca3c73f1.name: Office 365 Administrator

badge_template_activities.title: The earner gained a fundamental understanding of the M365 administration through a blended learning course that involved self-paced digital learning, facilitator-led workshops, and quizzes to test their knowledge. The course ensured that earners understood the capabilities of the core Microsoft 365 suite of tools and products.

The earner has created, reviewed, and updated their organization’s Office 365 deployment documentation and has made recommendations on any changes that can be made to improve their Office 365 environment.

be497301-6772-4598-9db7-e5a9394862eb.description: This badge signifies that the earner has completed 10 years of continuous service with QA, demonstrating hard work and commitment to the organisation.
be497301-6772-4598-9db7-e5a9394862eb.name: QA Long Service Award - 10 Years

badge_template_activities.title: Continuous service and commitment to learning delivery.
Continuous service and commitment to learning delivery.

74af967a-e263-4c11-9f13-afd54aa9e2fc.description: This badge signifies that the earner has completed 15 years of continuous service with QA, demonstrating hard work and commitment to the organisation.
74af967a-e263-4c11-9f13-afd54aa9e2fc.name: QA Long Service Award - 15 Years

badge_template_activities.title: Continuous service and commitment to learning delivery.
Continuous service and commitment to learning delivery.

fca96e44-148a-472a-a692-22c6895a2b9b.description: This badge signifies that the earner has completed 20 years of continuous service with QA, demonstrating hard work and commitment to the organisation.
fca96e44-148a-472a-a692-22c6895a2b9b.name: QA Long Service Award - 20 Years

badge_template_activities.title: Continuous service and commitment to learning delivery.
Continuous service and commitment to learning delivery.

89d3ea7d-23d3-4d8e-8ecf-81f823046b3e.description: This badge signifies that the earner has completed 25 years of continuous service with QA, demonstrating hard work and commitment to the organisation.
89d3ea7d-23d3-4d8e-8ecf-81f823046b3e.name: QA Long Service Award - 25 Years

badge_template_activities.title: Continuous service and commitment to learning delivery.
Continuous service and commitment to learning delivery.

68b5c405-561f-4d6e-b8ca-4eb8bc8d1599.description: This badge signifies that the earner has completed 5 years of continuous service with QA, demonstrating hard work and commitment to the organisation.
68b5c405-561f-4d6e-b8ca-4eb8bc8d1599.name: QA Long Service Award - 5 Years

badge_template_activities.title: Continuous service and commitment to learning delivery.
Continuous service and commitment to learning delivery.

035bd880-c0a9-44c6-a1d2-cbd0a9c2ec1f.description: Earners of this badge have proven fundamental theoretical and practical SharePoint Administration skills in a workplace context. In addition, earners will have demonstrated competence in designing best practice Sharepoint Online Architecture for sites, taxonomy, information architecture, content management, and Sharepoint security. Finally, earners of this badge will have developed fundamental SharePoint knowledge and competency, and undertaken a facilitated learning event.
035bd880-c0a9-44c6-a1d2-cbd0a9c2ec1f.name: SharePoint Online Design, Architecture and Administration

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge completed a blended learning course that involved both self-paced digital learning as well as facilitator-led workshops. Earners of this badge also gained an understanding of the key Sharepoint Online concepts and administrative tasks and tools, and demonstrated the skills to plan, design, deploy, and manage a best practice Sharepoint Online environment.

Individuals with this badge took their newly found SharePoint administration and architecture skills and apply them to their production environment. Individuals with this badge worked with their employer and training facilitator to individually define and fulfil activities to implement SharePoint best practice at work.

6ba636f5-ffef-470a-bc71-ac57f70f5bab.description: Earners of this badge have proven theoretical and practical C# programming skills within a workplace context. Earners have developed fundamental C# programming knowledge and competencies and learnt about key C# best practices. These practices include: writing short programs, using functions and packages, using documentation, comments, and consistent code style, writing C# programs that use external data sources or Object-Oriented methods, using error handling and testing to make programs robust.
6ba636f5-ffef-470a-bc71-ac57f70f5bab.name: The C# Programming Language

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earners completed a blended learning course that involved both self-paced digital learning as well as facilitator-led workshops. Earners gained a fundamental understanding of the key C# programming concepts and constructs through digital learning. Badge earners also applied this theoretical knowledge of C# in a hands-on environment, creating C# scripts, utilising the core C# syntax and Object Orientated Programming principles, as well as key techniques for storing and processing data.

Earners of this badge have designed and developed a C#-based application in the workplace. In building this application, earners have implemented OOP, used coding best practices, used appropriate testing techniques, and utilised effective source control into the process of app development.
